DOC.brief_title: Fall Prevention Program for Older Adults
DOC.detailed_description: The purpose of this study is to test the effectiveness of a fall prevention program for older adults. Participants assigned to the intervention group will train weekly on a special treadmill that will simulate tripping. Patients not assigned to the tripping program will walk on a standard treadmill. The training program will last for 4 weeks. Upon completion, participants will complete a test where a trip is simulated. Those assigned to the intervention group will test one additional time as well.
DOC.criteria: 6580 yr old, normal reflexes and muscle tone lower extremity fracture or surgery last 5 yrs back surgery or disc herniation last 5 yrs noticeable gait impairment, low back pain, decreased diseaserelated vision, dizziness, history of heart problems, bone mineral density <.65, minimental score <24
